definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack

pinyin: guang1 xian1 fen1 san4 shi4 zi1 liao4 jie4 mian4

sentences.english: For Lutfi, we scattered his ashes in the canal.
sentences.chinese: 對於陸，我們分散他的骨灰在運河。

sentences.english: A water-base drilling fluid that contains dispersed oil or synthetic hydrocarbon as an internal phase.
sentences.chinese: 分散的油滴或合成烴爲內相的水基鑽井液。

sentences.english: Corexit 9500 was found to be one of the most toxic dispersal agents ever developed.
sentences.chinese: 被發現是有史以來生產的最具毒性的分散劑之一。

sentences.english: The existence of the particle movement, increase block medium dispersion medium viscosity.
sentences.chinese: 粒子的存在阻礙介質的運動，增加分散介質的黏度。

sentences.english: After the dam was completed, the undisturbed soil samples from the dam were non-dispersive by some experiments.
sentences.chinese: 大壩建成後的壩體原狀土樣屬於非分散性粘土。

sentences.english: This feature is highly desirable for distributed systems with fault-tolerance consideration.
sentences.chinese: 此特性是分散系統考慮容錯功能時非常重要的需求。

sentences.english: But Putin has deftly managed the windfall and spread the wealth enough so that people feel hopeful.
sentences.chinese: 普京確實致力於將財富分散，所以人們覺得有盼頭。

sentences.english: Objective To prepare apigenin (AP) solid dispersion and measure its dissolution in vitro.
sentences.chinese: 目的製備芹菜素固體分散體，並檢測其體外溶出度。

sentences.english: You cound say more fragmented for a while.
sentences.chinese: 你可以說一段時間內會更加分散。

sentences.english: Break your concentration and the ball descends.
sentences.chinese: 你注意力一旦分散，小球就會下降。

sentences.english: Remove ambition and the essential elements of society seem to fly apart .
sentences.chinese: 沒有雄心，組成社會的諸要素就會分散開來。

sentences.english: To observe and compare the antithrombotic effects of myricetin dispersible tablets and myricetin dripping pills.
sentences.chinese: 觀察並比較楊梅素滴丸與楊梅素分散片的抗血栓作用。
他用談話分散她的注意力。

sentences.english: Unique peace and quiet dispersant and antioxidant.
sentences.chinese: 獨特的清淨分散劑和抗氧化劑。

sentences.english: The next stage of our analysis is to determine the dispersion of our dataset.
sentences.chinese: 分析的下一步是決定數據集的分散度。

sentences.english: Objective To study the antiulcer activities of almagate.
sentences.chinese: 目的研究鋁鎂加分散片的抗潰瘍作用。

definition: to concentrate/to centralize/to focus/centralized/concentrated/to put together
to shift/to divert or distract (attention etc)/to change/to transform/metastasis (medicine)/to evacuate (people)
to break up the whole into pieces (idiom); dealing with things one by one/divide and conquer
to scatter/to distribute/to be distributed (over an area etc)/(statistical, geographic) distribution
to come together (to form sth)/to assemble together/(chemistry) to polymerize
to scatter/to break sth up/to beat (an egg)
to transfer/to maneuver (troops etc)/movement of personnel/to mobilize/to bring into play
